{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:37:09.239
    | text      = Generally speaking, the Industrial Revolution is considered to be the period between 1760 and 1840,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:37:14.600
    | text      = and it was a period of rampant disease and death.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:37:17.159
    | text      = One of the reasons for this was that urbanization outpaced advances in sanitation,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:37:22.119
    | text      = and outbreaks of things like cholera were super common.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:37:25.960
    | text      = Because of how easy it was for water to be contaminated in these newly urban areas,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:37:30.039
    | text      = and how people were living in far greater density than they were before,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:37:33.640
    | text      = communicable diseases went absolutely nuts.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:37:36.199
    | text      = It's estimated that tuberculosis killed one third of everyone who died in the United Kingdom
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:37:40.439
    | text      = between 1800 and 1850,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:37:42.680
    | text      = because of the conditions brought on by the Industrial Revolution.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:37:46.199
    | text      = Serious researchers and historians are pretty uniformly behind the idea
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:37:49.560
    | text      = that industrialization had been a driver towards diminished health conditions.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:37:55.239
    | text      = One of the things that most devastated newly urbanized areas
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:37:58.760
    | text      = during the Industrial Revolution was smallpox.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:38:01.239
    | text      = It was so contagious and had a history of completely destroying worlds.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:38:05.239
    | text      = Spanish and Portuguese explorers introduced it to the new world,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:38:08.119
    | text      = and that pretty much spelled death for the Aztecs and the Inca.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:38:11.399
    | text      = It's a seriously fucked up dangerous disease.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:38:14.199
    | text      = It's said that in the 18th century, 400,000 people died from it every year in Europe,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:38:19.079
    | text      = and the fatality rate for children who contacted it was reported at between 80 and 98 percent,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:38:24.680
    | text      = depending on what country in Europe they got it in.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:38:27.880
    | text      = That's a bummer.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:38:28.680
    | text      = That's a lot.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:38:29.399
    | text      = That's a bummer.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:38:30.359
    | text      = Everyone knew that once you got smallpox and survived, you couldn't get it again.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:38:34.760
    | text      = People knew that going back to approximately 430 BCE,

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:39:14.840
    | text      = In 1796, a doctor named Edward Jenner decided to start experimenting with

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = and he began experimenting with cowpox.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:39:37.000
    | text      = This would eventually lead to him inventing vaccination,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:39:45.000

}}

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
